steps.title: Get blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Get blank sheet of paper. Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.

steps.title: Get a pencil.
steps.content: Get a pencil. With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.

steps.title: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
steps.content: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes. Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.

steps.title: Draw the exact same rectangle behind the first one.
steps.content: Draw the exact same rectangle behind the first one. The higher or lower you put it, the longer your box will be.

steps.title: Draw two lines connecting the two bottom corners.
steps.content: Draw two lines connecting the two bottom corners. This will be the bottom of your box.

steps.title: Draw two lines connecting the two top corners.
steps.content: Draw two lines connecting the two top corners. This is the top of your box.

steps.title: Get blank sheet of paper.
steps.content: Get blank sheet of paper. Any type will do, but if you're starting as beginner, graph paper is best.

steps.title: Get a pencil.
steps.content: Get a pencil. With a pencil, you can erase any mistakes.

steps.title: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes.
steps.content: Draw a rectangle or square using the boxes. Make sure you only draw on the line to make sure it's straight.

steps.title: Draw one line slanting upwards.
steps.content: Draw one line slanting upwards. This is the bottom side of your box.

steps.title: Draw two lines slanting upwards on the top.
steps.content: Draw two lines slanting upwards on the top. This is the top of the box.
